replies.msg:
Forza Milan


2017/2018球季意甲賽程：



2017/2018球季歐霸十六強：



常見問題：

AC米蘭同國際米蘭又係有"米蘭"，應該點分？
ANS：AC米蘭簡稱米蘭，國際米蘭叫國米，避免稱呼做AC，因為AC係球會咁解，而milan先係名既簡稱。

AC米蘭仲係咪「老人院」？
ANS：現時全隊平均年齡為25歲。

今個轉會窗到目前為止簽咗咁多球員，遲啲仲會唔會有錢買人？
ANS：其實買球員好少會一炮過畀，多數都係分期，所以仲會有錢簽其他球員。

簽咗咁多球員會唔會過唔到FFP？
ANS：早前米蘭管理層有同UEFA探討經營計劃。
http://sempremilan.com/ts-fassone-meets-uefa-to-discuss-ac-milan-business-plan（By 二石四鳥）[/quote]

賽後安達施華在接受採訪時表示：“入球得分對我來說意味著所有，我想感謝每一個人，包括工作人員和我的隊友們。如果我無法得到太多出場時間，那是因為我必須在工作中付出更多努力。”

“之前，我在意甲聯賽中還沒有取得過入球，我真的特別開心，即使蘇素的傳中質量並不是很好(笑)。

Milan push for Swansea’s Ki?

Milan are reportedly in advanced talks to sign midfielder Ki Sung-yueng, whose Swansea City contract is about to expire.

According to Calciomercato.com, there is already a ‘general agreement’ between Milan sporting director Massimiliano Mirabelli and Ki’s representatives.

Furthermore, the website believes a medical and the South Korean’s signature is just ‘a few weeks away’ as he ‘only wants’ the Rossoneri, despite receiving offers from other Premier League clubs.

The 29-year-old joined the Swans from Celtic in 2012 and has gone on to make over 150 appearances in Wales, although he spent the 2013-14 campaign on loan at Sunderland, where he played alongside Fabio Borini and Emanuele Giaccherini.

CM notes his “technical and tactical qualities have been known to Milan’s scouts for a long time”, while he “guarantees physicality, a good goal return and the versatility to play in several roles.”

Milan could make it a hat-trick of free agents this summer, with deals for Ivan Strinic and Pepe Reina also in the pipeline.
韓撚不了

Napoli agree Torreira terms?
By Football Italia staff

Napoli have reportedly agreed terms with Sampdoria’s Lucas Torreira but must now decide whether to pay his €25m release clause.

According to Corriere dello Sport, Torreira has accepted Napoli’s offer of a five-year contract worth €1.5m a season.

It would now be left to the two clubs to agree a fee, although the midfielder’s €25m release clause gives Samp some leverage.

However, Il Corriere warns the buyout figure is only valid until July 15, meaning the Partenopei are possibly in no rush to enter negotiations.

The 21-year-old has scored four goals in 29 appearances for the Blucerchiati this season and recently earned his first call-up to the Uruguay squad.

英超盛世
歐洲冠軍聯賽分組賽結束，有十六隊進入淘汰賽階段，其中英超聯球隊佔了五席，西甲三席，意甲兩席，德甲一席，法甲一席……看球隊分佈，英超球隊之多，創歷史紀錄，氣勢之盛，令球迷側目。西甲年年起碼在16強佔三席的，因為皇馬、巴塞實力超群，年年穩入淘汰賽階段，馬體會在阿根廷教練帶領下，過去五年三次入四強，兩次晉決賽，也是實力之選，但今屆馬體會似乎缺乏出色新人補充實力，在西甲已漸失氣勢，在歐聯出局，席位由實力不算高強，勝在韌力十足的西維爾替代，不算意外。法甲與德甲的整體發展不健康，分別是巴黎聖日耳門與拜仁慕尼黑獨大，可見壟斷其實傷害整體，競爭才是正道。其他球會無法與此兩霸競爭，即使有幸踢歐聯分組賽，也是陪跑分子。
英超是香港最受歡迎的聯賽，朋友中不乏曼聯迷（人數佔壓倒性優勢），也有利物浦粉絲，擁曼城、車路士的也有，熱刺粉絲似乎少見，至於阿仙奴迷，長期在雲格領導下，多年未有在大賽取勝，已近乎絕望了，今年阿仙奴如能在歐霸杯奪標，明年如今屆曼聯般取得踢歐聯的資格，或可挽回少少擁躉的士氣。
五隊英超入16強，究竟有無奪標希望？細看最強的對手，前兩屆冠軍皇馬今年已失光芒，水準不復去年，分組賽以一比三敗予熱刺，失色得令人吃驚；巴塞則見中場指揮官恩尼斯達開始老化，前鋒蘇亞雷斯已無銳利感，只有美斯憑他的神級腳法，仍然令所有守衛恐懼，但整隊已無必勝氣概，要趁對方犯錯或氣力不繼時才可取勝；拜仁實力與前兩年差不多，也有皇馬巴塞的同樣問題，陣中有經驗老將年紀已大，主力羅賓、列貝利速度不如前，只靠李雲度夫斯基，至於聖日耳門，因有天價球星尼馬及麥碧比，加上烏拉圭前鋒卡雲尼，攻力驚人，銳氣當起，是熱門冠軍對象。五隊英超之中，起碼有三隊可以進入8強，曼城是理想當然的決賽隊伍，車路士次之，曼聯與熱刺有歐洲第一線的實力，但全隊似是尚待進步的未完成產品，利物浦的後防太失準，好的時候似模似樣，差的時候似漏水土泥牆，但眾多球隊之中，利物浦的平均速度最快，四名攻擊球員古天奴、沙拿、曼尼、費明奴被稱為The Fabulous 4，已合作嫻熟，反擊力十分強大，非一般後防所能抵禦。左丁山大膽預測明年五月的歐聯決賽，很可能是聖日耳門、曼城、利物浦或可爆冷門！
https://hk.lifestyle.appledaily.com/lifestyle/columnist/%E5%B7%A6%E4%B8%81%E5%B1%B1/daily/article/20171213/20242479

Gattuso: 'I like Wilshere a lot'

Milan boss Gennaro Gattuso is impressed with Arsenal’s Jack Wilshere, who “combines English grit with Spanish technique, but he’s unusual.”

The 26-year-old will be a free agent in June and has repeatedly been linked with a move to Serie A.

“I remember him when I came here to play a tournament in 2011,” said Gattuso when asked about Wilshere ahead of their Europa League encounter.

“He isn’t particularly fast, but does have good technique. He can make the ball do the running and knows where to put it. He can play both as a support striker and playmaker.

“Wilshere had a lot of physical problems and is a player I always appreciated, but he’s unusual. He combines English grit with Spanish technique. I like him a lot.”

Exclusive: AC Milan and Arsenal after Schalke midfielder

CalcioMercato have exclusively learnt that Serie A giants AC Milan are tracking the progress of Schalke midfielder Max Meyer.

The 22-year-old Meyer has been known to be one of Germany's best young talents since quite sometime now and has impressed this season for Schalke and has done well while being played in a deeper midfield role. He has appeared 22 times in the Bundesliga for the Royal Blues, becoming a vital player under Domenico Tedesco.

CalcioMercato understand that Milan are looking at Meyer to solve their midfield problems and Massimilano Mirabelli met a member of Meyer's agency in Casa Milan recently to discuss about the midfielder's future.

The track for the rossoneri though, isn't easy. As Meyer might prefer a move to the Premier League and Arsenal are also said to be interested in him and could make a move if Jack Wilshere doesn't extent his stay at the Emirates for next season.

Milan go for Depay?

Milan are reportedly preparing a summer assault for Olympique Lyonnais winger Memphis Depay.

According to Tuttosport, Milan will try to sign a winger this summer and have targeted Depay for his ‘flair and pace’.

Arab offer for Milan?

It’s reported that a member Dubai's royal family is interested in buying Milan, amid doubts over Yonghong Li’s finances.

The Rossoneri were bought over by the Chinese businessman last April, but a loan from US hedge fund Elliot Management was required to get the deal over the line.

If that money isn’t repaid the fund can take over the club, so the Diavolo are seeking to refinance that debt with another lender.

Today though the Gazzetta dello Sport is reporting that there is interest in taking over the club, not least from Saeed Al-Falasi.

The businessman is the owner of the International Triangle group, and is a part of the Al Maktoum family which rules Dubai.

Meanwhile, the newspaper also reports that UEFA could grant Milan an extension on the deadline for their settlement agreement with Financial Fair Play.

The Rossoneri are due to meet with European football’s governing body on April 20 after their voluntary agreement was rejected.

If Li hasn’t managed to refinance the debt to Elliot by then, in theory the Diavolo would have to be excluded from European competition, but UEFA has no desire to do that so could give an extension until the beginning of June.

replies.msg:
KPB: ‘Not Milan without Berlusconi’

Kevin-Prince Boateng “could never have imagined” a Milan without Silvio Berlusconi, and would “never say no” to a return.

The Eintracht Frankfurt forward had two spells with the Rossoneri, winning the Scudetto in 2011.

“I could never have imagined a Milan without Berlusconi, I’m serious,” Boateng told Tuttomercatoweb.

“Il Cavaliere will always be a part of Rossoneri history, it’s impossible not to miss him. On a personal level I can only say thank you, because he helped me become a man.

“Would I go back? Of course! I’d go back to Milan right away, I could never say no. At the same time though I like being realistic and I know it’s almost impossible.

“All my seasons in Rossonero were incredible, I hold on to unique memories. I’m proud to have worn such an important shirt, it was an honour.

“At Milan I played with a lot of champions, but if I had to name one in particular I’d go for Ronaldinho. He really was the strongest of all.”

Calhanoglu: 'Ref man of the match'

Hakan Calhanoglu did not hold back in his criticism after Milan’s defeat to Arsenal. “The referee was man of the match. I will never forget that.”

His strike had put the Rossoneri ahead on the night and back in the tie after a 2-0 first leg loss, but Danny Welbeck’s blatant dive earned a penalty.

“We played well and it’s not easy to do that here. We scored and then conceded an incredible goal, it’s not normal in the Europa League to see something like that,” Calhanoglu told Milan TV.

“Ricardo Rodriguez didn’t touch him, but for the referee it was a penalty anyway. I was fouled in the first leg and didn’t let myself go like that.

“It’s obvious that was the incident that changed the game. We reacted well even after their equaliser and had chances, but this is football.

“The referee was the man of the match and I will never forget that.”

賽後領隊分別
Wenger: 'I didn't see penalty'

Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger insisted he “didn’t see” Danny Welbeck dive to earn a Europa League penalty against Milan.

The Gunners had won the first leg 2-0, but Hakan Calhanoglu’s strike re-opened the tie in London until moments later Welbeck ‘earned’ a spot-kick, putting them on their way to an eventual 3-1 result.

“When I watch the penalty, I will give you an honest answer,” Wenger told BT Sport.

“It was a good response from the team at 1-0 down. I don’t want to accuse Danny Welbeck of diving before I see it again.

"It's much better, we needed that to recover from our results.

"It shows how the team has responded. We had a difficult game but in the end we won it.

"It was an open game. We played backwards a bit too much in the first half to protect the result. We played a very good side.

"We have to improve defensively, but overall we are team with technical quality which is more offense-minded.

"We struggle a bit more when we have to defend. We finished the game more compact and more solid.

"We would certainly want to avoid Atletico Madrid, but we will see, we have no influence over that."

Wenger also spoke to Sky Sport Italia after the game.

“Milan have a lot of quality and we approached the game too defensively to begin with, as we wanted to protect the first leg lead.

“In the second half we played much better. I give my compliments to Milan, as they made life difficult for us. Gattuso has done an exceptional job with a club that was in crisis. The team is balanced and they are good in attack.”

Here again, the manager was asked about the controversial penalty.

“I don’t know if it was a penalty or not, I haven’t seen it. Perhaps we were a little lucky, I don’t know, but we replied well to Milan taking the advantage.”

Gattuso: 'No Milan alibis'

Gennaro Gattuso refused to listen to “alibis, as referees make mistakes just like players. Milan lost qualification at San Siro” against Arsenal.

The Rossoneri were beaten 2-0 at home in the first leg, but had re-opened the tie with a Hakan Calhanoglu strike at the Emirates when Danny Welbeck dived for a shocking penalty.

From there, Arsenal grew in confidence and eventually won 3-1 on the night.

“I am proud of my lads, the qualification was lost at San Siro. What makes me angry is when we give up after going 2-1 down and concede the third. We have to keep going,” Gattuso told Sky Sport Italia.

“I don’t want to talk about the referee, because they can make mistakes just like players do. I am proud of my lads and we have to continue on this path.

“I think the team is raising the bar in Italy, these two games against a very strong Arsenal side showed we could cause them problems. I don’t look for alibis.

“As I said, I’m most angry about the third goal, because we shouldn’t let our heads drop and leave the field after going behind. We have to stay in it to the 90th minute.

“Now we have to take it one game at a time. I don’t want to hear any alibis right now, as we got it wrong at San Siro two weeks ago.

“This is a side that is young, can do a lot more and reach the levels where Arsenal are at right now. They have more experience and attacking nous.”

There was also a howler from Gianluigi Donnarumma to allow in a seemingly harmless snapshot.

“Donnarumma has to lift his head and move on. The greatest goalkeepers in the world make mistakes, so does Donnarumma, it’s not an issue. We just have to protect him and look forward. I have great confidence and respect in Gigio.”

Gattuso moved to a 4-4-2 system this evening with Suso and Calhanoglu as wingers, Patrick Cutrone and Andre Silva upfront.

“We had two lines of four and two strikers. The development in attack was very similar to 4-3-3, it was only when we lost possession that we effectively changed to 4-4-2.

“Franck Kessie was meant to push forward more, but I liked the character of the team and the way we attacked.

“Nikola Kalinic has more experience than Cutrone and Andre Silva, naturally. He moves very well, but at the moment is struggling with fitness issues and we know if he is in shape, he can give us a huge hand.

“Having two strikers is an option, so is one, the important thing is to play and work calmly.”

Tax fraud investigation for Raiola?

Italian newspaper Il Fatto Quotidiano claims there is an investigation into agent Mino Raiola and his clients over potential tax fraud.

According to Friday’s edition of the paper, Dutch authorities are going over his finances with a fine-tooth comb.

Among the businesses under the spotlight is Maguire Tax and Legal in Amsterdam.

“It is not my business. If my players use it, I am not the one who obliges them to,” Raiola is quoted as saying.

Among Raiola’s clients are Gianluigi Donnarumma of Milan, Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba, Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Mario Balotelli.

He was born in Italy, but moved to the Netherlands with his family as a baby and started working as a football agent in the early 1990s.
